data.title: maverick: Name Meaning, Origin, History, And Popularity
data.meta_description: The name Maverick is a unisex name that symbolizes your child’s free spirit. Check out this post for unique and intriguing trivia about the stylish name.
data.text:
In This Article

Origin, Meaning, And History Of Maverick

A unisex name with American origins, Maverick may mean an unbranded animal or calf separated from its herd. The name means ‘an independent person who avoids conformity.’ Mostly given to boys, Maverick is a standout name that symbolizes someone independent, free-minded, and who likes to think outside society’s usual parameters. Although a given name, it was initially used as a surname in the 1900s.

The unisex name Maverick has attained popularity in the United States but does not hold the same status in other countries. The name also inspires a person to form a unique path with their life.

It only has one spelling Maverick. However, variations such as Maverik, Mavrick, or Mavric do exist.

Pop culture characters with humble roots in agriculture popularized the name. The word ‘maverick’ comes from Samuel Maverick, a politician, lawyer, and cattle farmer from Texas who lived in the 19th century. He refused to brand his cattle which was uncommon at the time. This incident led to people calling rebellious people with unbranded cattle ‘mavericks.’

The word ‘maverick’ entered the popular glossary because of the popularity of the ABC TV show Maverick. The show followed four honest and ethical brothers who won riches playing poker and then traveled to some beautiful places on their horses.

Recently, the name garnered a fan following after the success of the successful and superhit film Top Gun in 1986 and its sequel Top Gun: Maverick starring Tom Cruise in 2022. He played the lead character of Pete “Maverick” Mitchell, a rebellious fighter pilot.

The name Maverick may sound familiar because of the famous NBA basketball team Dallas Mavericks who have one NBA Championship under their belt.

How To Pronounce Maverick?

Notable People Named Maverick

This section covers people who have made the name Maverick famous with their contributions in various fields. It indeed is a little more inspiration for you to choose the name for your baby, don’t you think?

Maverick CarterAn American businessman and media personality and a co-founder of SpringHill entertainment

Maverick SabreThe stage name of Michael Stafford, an Irish singer, songwriter, and rapper

Maverick Viñales RuizA Spanish Grand Prix motorcycle racer and the 2013 Moto3 World Champion

Maverick Scott McNealyAn American professional golfer who, in late 2016 and early 2017, was the number one ranked golfer in the World Amateur Golf Ranking

Maverick Name’s Presence On Social Media

Before you finalize your baby’s name, you would want to assess if the name is rare or popular. Digital footprint of the name - it’s presence on the internet and social media platforms - can provide you with valuable insights on it’s popularity. A name’s online presence is an important metric for new parents to evaluate their options and make an informed choice. How many people are searching the name on Google, how many profiles are there on Facebook, does the name have a Wikipedia page? Such information surely tells you if the name is ubiquitous or unique. Here is how Maverick fares on that count.

Maverick’s Zodiac Sign As Per Western Astrology

Western astrology includes the construction of a horoscope based on the person’s exact time of birth and location to understand the positions of the planet, stars, and zodiac signs at that time. However, in popular culture, it is often narrowed down to the sun sign, which depends on the person’s birth date.There are 12 zodiac signs, each having dominant traits, planetary rulers, elemental connection, and more.

Zodiac sign or Sun sign

The Earth’s orbit around the sun is divided into 12 zodiac signs covering 30-degree sectors. According to Western astrology, the zodiac or sun sign depends on the sun’s position in one of these sectors at the time of your birth. Starting from the sun’s position at the March equinox, the chart goes anti-clockwise from Aries, followed by Taurus, Gemini, Cancer, Leo, Virgo, Libra, Scorpio, Sagittarius, Capricorn, Aquarius, and Pisces. These signs are ruled by planetary bodies - Mars, Venus, Mercury, Moon, Sun, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune. Furthermore, they are categorized into triplicities or elemental signs - fire, water, air, and earth - that govern their characteristics. Each of these zodiac signs features certain personality traits that may determine how a person presents themselves.

Each zodiac sign in Western astrology is linked to a specific range of dates in the year. Unlike Vedic astrology, where names can sometimes be used to infer astrological details, Western astrology relies entirely on the birth date.

To know more about your baby’s zodiac sign, choose the period in which your baby’s date of birth falls, from the options given below. This will give you a glimpse into the world of astrology tailored for your baby.

Maverick’s Zodiac Sign And Birth Star As Per Vedic Astrology

Maverick Personality Traits As Per Numerology

The numerology belief system envisages a relationship between a name and numbers. The related numbers are believed to give insights into a person’s character. We have researched this area to connect the numerology-based characteristic traits to the letters of the English alphabet. And the results are fascinating.

Numerology followers believe that each letter signifies attributes that can influence a person’s attitude and approach. Among these placements, the most significant are the first letter (Cornerstone) and the last letter (Capstone) of a name. Cornerstone highlights your primary personality traits and explains how you face challenges and opportunities in life. Capstone can tell you about your approach to work and how you complete them. Often, a letter may be repeated twice or more in a name. This repetition signifies the intensification or amplification of the traits associated with the letter in an individual’s personality.

Read to know what characteristics the name Maverick is known for in numerology. Here we have avoided repetition of letters and added them just once for a better reading experience.

MYou are introspective, diligent, and pragmatic. You love to be independent but can be quite a workaholic..

AYou are ambitious, brave, and independent. You tend to be dominating and seek power and status.

VYou are sincere, responsible, and caring. You enjoy domesticity and humanitarian work.

EYou may be suitable for financial, legal, and public work. However, a repetition of these letters more than seven times can indicate frivolity.

RYou are sensitive, creative, and emotional. You are always patient and like to help others.

IYou are ambitious, brave, and independent. You tend to be dominating and seek power and status.

CYou are talented, expressive, and imaginative. You have a magnetic personality and enjoy artistic pursuits.

KYour goals can sometimes be idealistic. But the manageable ones leave you feeling inspired and rejuvenated.

Infographic: Know The Name Maverick‘s Personality As Per Numerology
